page.title: 04EDINBURGH, SHOPS vs CENTRE
page.content: We visited 12 shops consisting of 7 food shops (2 grocers, delicatessen, baker, dairy, confectionary and a greengrocer)and 5 others( chemist, ironmonger and 3 newsagents. 5 of the shops had been in business for many years and the sweet shop since 19th century. Since Cameron Toll Shopping Centre was built, most of the shops had been forced to lower their prices. Some said that business had been reduced. One shop had been an ironmonger for 43 years and had felt a recent big loss of business.The Centre with 45 shops had been built on a very good site at the junction of many main routes in the quiet bit of the city.People could easily use cars or the good bus service to do their main shopping. Now the local shops served the older folk who weren't able to travel.
